summary: This bill, the Ocmulgee Mounds National Park and Preserve Establishment Act, aims to establish the Ocmulgee Mounds National Park and Preserve in Georgia. It redesignates the existing Ocmulgee Mounds National Historical Park and establishes a National Preserve, allowing for land acquisition through purchase, donation, or exchange (but not eminent domain). It outlines administration details, mandates a management plan, addresses hunting and fishing regulations, and prioritizes hiring members of the Muscogee (Creek) Nation. The bill also places approximately 126 acres of tribal land into trust and authorizes appropriations.
